entities: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)
summary:
The Security Council:
Recalling previous resolutions on Sierra Leone, welcomes the Secretary-General's report (S/2011/554) and decides to extend the mandate of UNIPSIL for one year, until 15 September 2012. 
The Council notes preparations for 2012 elections, stressing the importance of a conducive environment for peaceful, transparent, free, and fair elections. 
It welcomes efforts to implement the 2 April 2009 Joint Communiqu√©, prevent political violence, and promote women's participation. 
The Council commends the Government's progress in implementing the Agenda for Change, but notes remaining challenges. 
It recognizes the threats of illicit drug trafficking, corruption, and youth unemployment, and welcomes progress under the West Africa Coast Initiative. 
The Council emphasizes the need for continued integrated support from the UN system and the international community. 
It commends UNIPSIL's contribution to peacebuilding efforts and encourages the implementation of the UN Joint Vision. 
The 2012 elections will be a major milestone in consolidating peace and security, defining UNIPSIL's transition into a UN country team. 
The Council reiterates its appreciation for the Peacebuilding Commission, Peacebuilding Fund, and the Special Court for Sierra Leone. 
It recalls the responsibility for controlling small arms and light weapons and welcomes the launch of the national action plan. 
The Council welcomes the role of the African Union and ECOWAS and encourages regional organizations to continue their dialogue. 
Decides to extend UNIPSIL's mandate, as set out in resolution 1941 (2010), until 15 September 2012.
The Security Council:

2. Emphasizes UNIPSIL's objectives with the UN country team, within their mandates, focusing on: 
    i. Supporting 2012 elections preparation and providing technical assistance to stakeholders for peaceful, credible, and democratic elections.
    ii. Assisting conflict prevention and mitigation efforts, promoting dialogue among parties.
    iii. Tackling youth unemployment through training, education, and skills provision.
    iv. Implementing the Sierra Leone National Action Plan on Women, Peace and Security.
    v. Promoting good governance, rule of law, human rights, and combating corruption.

3. Calls on the Government, parties, and stakeholders to contribute to a peaceful and tolerant atmosphere for the 2012 elections.

4. Calls on Sierra Leone authorities to resolve outstanding electoral legal framework issues.
